medical_history.history_of_present_illness: Patient was recovering well after elective laparoscopic cholecystectomy but later returned with worsening abdominal and back pain. Symptoms included intermittent nausea and one episode of vomiting. At presentation, the patient denied nausea, fevers, chest pain, and dyspnea.
medical_history.past_medical_history:
- Coronary artery disease status post CABG
- Pulmonary hypertension
- Atrial fibrillation on Coumadin
- Chronic obstructive pulmonary disease (COPD)
- Interstitial lung disease (ILD)
- Hypertension
- Hyperlipidemia
- Type 2 diabetes
- Previous cerebrovascular accident (CVA) with residual left facial droop
- Previous history of cocaine use (stopped)
- Ovarian cancer (low grade, incidental finding after TAH/BSO for fibroids)
- Gastritis
medical_history.family_history: Father died at age of an aneurysmal bleed. Brothers with stroke and one brother died of myocardial infarction in his early years. Sister has breast cancer.
